description.value: Provenance profile to be used on Grunndata. Person, Practitioner, Organization etc.

definition.value:
Grunndata: Provenance resources for the Grunndata-services should identify their provenance by a counter identifier that identifies the sequence that the Provenance resources where registered on the Grunndata-service.
The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

Grunndata: Provenance resources themself should probably not exist in more than one version.
The version specific identifier, as it appears in the version portion of the URL. This value changes when the resource is created, updated, or deleted.

Grunndata uses the target element to reference the UPDATED version of the resource instance, after the recorded activity described by the Provenance resource has taken place. This is one reason the references in the target element SHOULD always be version specific. There is one exception when the Provenance describes a Delete transaction (Delete activity), in that case the target contains the reference/identifier of the deleted version of the resource: http://hl7.org/fhir/provenance.html#removal
The Reference(s) that were generated or updated by the activity described in this resource. A provenance can point to more than one target if multiple resources were created/updated by the same activity.

In some cases when you provide a reference to another resource instance you also want to specificly express a reference to specific elements of the target resource. Can contain the reference to the element and the change in value.

Grunndata: When the activity leading to the change occurred in another system (FREG ex.) This would be the registered dates from that system.
The period during which the activity occurred.

Grunndata: The time the change was recorded by the Grunndata system.
The instant of time at which the activity was recorded.

Grunndata don't use this element.
Policy or plan the activity was defined by. Typically, a single activity may have multiple applicable policy documents, such as patient consent, guarantor funding, etc.

Grunndata don't use this element.
Where the activity occurred, if relevant.

Grunndata uses the reason code to communicate the original change event type from the data source, usually FREG event types.
The reason that the activity was taking place.
The event type from FREG that thescribes the change to the Master Person Index in some detail.

Grunndata uses this element to document what kind of transaction changed the content of the resource. Only codes identifying Data operation types will be used: http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/v3-DataOperation
An activity is something that occurs over a period of time and acts upon or with entities; it may include consuming, processing, transforming, modifying, relocating, using, or generating entities.

http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/v3-DataOperation
The identification of the code system that defines the meaning of the symbol in the code.

Grunndata uses who.display value to describe the organization responsible for the change.
An actor taking a role in an activity for which it can be assigned some degree of responsibility for the activity taking place.

Grunndata uses display value to describe the organization responsible for the change.
Plain text narrative that identifies the resource in addition to the resource reference.

Grunndata uses this element to identify the resources updated during the activity recorded by the Provenance resource. Should be version specific reference to resources that are updated. When the provenance records the first generation of a resource the entity element can be empty.
An entity used in this activity.

meaningWhenMissing.value: When the provenance records the first generation of a resource the entity element can be empty.

definition.value:
Grunndata will use revision | quotation | source | removal.
How the entity was used during the activity.

Grunndata uses this element to identify the resources updated during the activity recorded by the Provenance resource. Should be version specific reference to resources that are updated.
Identity of the Entity used. May be a logical or physical uri and maybe absolute or relative.

comment.value:
Grunndata don't use this element
The elements of the Signature Resource are for ease of access of these elements. For digital signatures (Xml DigSig, JWS), the non-repudiation proof comes from the Signature validation, which includes validation of the referenced objects (e.g. Resources) (a.k.a., Content) in the XML-Signature Detached form.
